name: infernal2bsml
description: Turns infernal raw output into bsml.

options.description: The table output from Infernal's 'cmsearch' run.
Where the output bsml file should be
[DEPRECATED] The script will parse the project from the sequence id. Used in id generation. It's the first token in the id. (Ex. project.class.number.version)
Used to make the ids (See Ergatis::IdGenerator for details)
Path to the query file (input fasta file) for infernal.
A non-zero value will result in compressed bsml output. If no .gz is on the end of the bsml output name, one will be added.
Whether or not to expect infernal 1.0 or later output. If left off then the assumption is that the input is pre-infernal 1.0
A list file containing the existing annotation bsml. This will activate the appending of the genome tag to the output bsml.

The path to the stockholm files that contain the alignments for the Rfam CMs. This is required if you want a good type to be assigned to your hits. Can be a directory with the CM IDs in the file names, or a file with all CMs.
The default SO type to be assigned to either all hits or only those hits that don't have a valid SO mapping in their stockholm file (if --stockholm_path is specified).
In case you wanted a log file.
There are no debug statements in this program. Sorry.
